timeline.bodyText: These fields would normally be private in a unit test.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Generally, it's a good idea to have throws Exception rather than a more specific one in the signature of test methods.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: Let's omit the use of final here. Let's also break out these additions as separate unit tests to illustrate them individually.
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: The assertions are in the wrong order. It's assertEquals(expected, actual)
timeline.author: ashleyfrieze

timeline.bodyText: This change should probably be reverted.

Similarly, you don't need to make a new lambda every time for this. You just want something like:
protected static final ResponseExtractor<String> EXTRACT_BODY_AS_STRING =  clientHttpResponse -> IOUtils.toString(clientHttpResponse.getBody(), Charset.defaultCharset());
